alert.note: Alert for Gibson (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 1:46PM EST until further notice by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Patoka River near Princeton affecting Gibson County. .Heavy rain that fell last week, combined with expected rain this week, will cause the Patoka River to rise above flood stage at Princeton on Wednesday. THe river should remain in flood through the remainder of the week. For the Patoka River...including Princeton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Patoka River near Princeton. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 19.8 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall to 18.7 feet and begin rising again early Tuesday afternoon. It will rise to 19.1 feet Thursday, March 03. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
